titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Frederick C. Schmid (1908-1974) worked on museum exhibits at the Academy of Natural Sciences. Schmid was also an ornithologist. He studied endangered species of birds at Patuxent Wildlife Research Center in Laurel, Maryland, and then became director of the Elizabeth Morton Wildlife Refuge in Sag Harbor, Long Island, New York. He wrote columns on conservation and ecology for two Long Island newspapers.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of five notebooks of Schmid's birding notes from 1931 to 1963. The notebooks contain narrative descriptions of birding walks and Schmid's work banding birds, lists of sightings of birds by species, and miscellaneous notes about plants and trees and Schmid's garden. The collection also includes one letter from Ed Fingerhood from 1996.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
